channel.title: Home on SIGKILL
channel.description: Recent content in Home on SIGKILL

item.title: Hello World!
item.author: cr4sh@sigkill.no (cr4sh0v3rrid3)
item.description: I did it! I finally found time to actually put up a blog. As part of loving the simplicity of the old web and as a avid complainer of how modern websites are way to bloated, I’ve made an attemt at keepubg this blog as simple as possible. Instead of spinning my own theme I ended up using a pre-made one, simpliy because I found one that had exactly what I needed and nothing else.

item.title: Alacritty terminfo
item.author: cr4sh@sigkill.no (cr4sh0v3rrid3)
item.description: To get alacritty to work with remote hosts: $ infocmp > al.txt $ scp al.txt <user>@<host>:~/ # On the remote host: $ tic -x al.txt What does “tic -x” do? $ man tic ... -x Treat unknown capabilities as user-defined (see user_caps(5)). That is, if you supply a capability name which tic does not recognize, it will infer its type (Boolean, number or string) from the syntax and make an extended table entry for that.
